website_summaries.verdict: One of the best RV stabilizer jacks you can buy without spending too much money.
pros: These stabilizers keep your RV or trailer steady so it doesn't bounce when you walk in it
Swiveling stabilizer pole rotates easily to adjust the jack to the appropriate height
cons: If this is used at the full 17-inch extension, it becomes a little wobbly

customer_reviews.title: Although it was a trial and error effort to find the best location for them
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these to supplement my trailer's stabilizers. They definitely made a difference when I installed them after leveling out my trailer. Although it was a trial and error effort to find the best location for them. At first I placed one in front and one in back of each axle wheel. There was still a bit if rocking. I then moved them closer ro each corner of my trailer frame. Bingo! My trailer feels very stable. Note that these are for stabilizing purposes only and it isn't meant to be used for lifting your trailer. It even says so right on the frame of each jack.
customer_reviews.author: StrykEagle

customer_reviews.title: Simple, and they work
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to help stabilize our camper. We were still having some pretty wild rocking forward and back even after blocking the wheels, so I bought these jacks. One each on the front corners of the frame (there were already stabilizer jacks at the back) made our camper rock solid, and I didn't have to install any hardware. When done, the support comes out of the base, and the bases stack neatly so they hardly take up any space. When I got them I wasn't even convinced there were four in the box until I opened it. Absolutely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stabalizer Jacks for the price
customer_reviews.text: Thanks everyone for watching the only thing you can't see is the base of these are square with the sides measuring 4 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: These are great jacks to stabilize your RV
customer_reviews.text: These are great jacks to stabilize your RV. It is solid as a rack and easy to level out. You will need 8 total for a 30+ RV. Four for each side. Easier that using wood and you can quickly remove the blocks if you want the move the RV
customer_reviews.author: TATD

customer_reviews.title: Great for moderate leveling and blocking. Wobbles at full extension.
customer_reviews.text: I got the set of 4 jack stands for $17. This makes it a fantastic value. The jacks have about 10cm (4") of adjustment before they get too wobbly for loads. However with blocks under the base and between the pad and trailer frame the 10cm range is good enough to level the load over reasonably flat ground. Adjustment is easy from about 25 to 35cm (10 to 14"). The rotating pad gives good support and won't put too much force into a small area on the trailer. The aluminum base is light but strong and stable. I use the stands to take the full weight off of my trailer for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Nicer Than Average

customer_reviews.title: cost effective and work effective.
customer_reviews.text: Win, Win here. with the exception of one spindle these worked as advertised and well. As I said, one spindle and cup was welded off-center making it tilt under load. Put it in a vise and realigned the shaft and it worked ok. If you're leaving your trailer in one spot for a while, i.e. Months, then these are the thing you want. Put some shoring timber between your trailer and the jack and you'll be rock steady and happy. Remember, these are NOT jacking/leveling style jacks just stabilizers. Beware if you use them wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Makeitright!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. If you want a JACK STAND tho, go buy a JACK STAND and not these
customer_reviews.text: Just buy them. Exactly what they say they are. For the ppl w the bad reviews. They are LEVELING jacks. You don't jack the camaro on the front lawn and leave these under it for months. Says right on the package not for lifting. Yes they are good for 6000lbs but they are clearly not jack stands. Meant to be used so the 6000lbs RV, etc doesn't wobble instead of using blocks of wood these are much nicer, easier to handle, have more uses and just look better. If you want a jack stand, go purchase a JACK STAND.
customer_reviews.author: Jdougheei

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: And a good fit for pop up campers not for heavier units. Directions included with the units say the saddle ,which is the top ,should make contact with the "C channel" on the camper trailer a reference to the type of frame the camping unit is attached to. . No mention of C channel use is made in Amazon promotion material. I attached mine to a flat trailer frame hoping the weight of the camper will keep it from moving. An inspection eye needed after heavy rains due to soft ground
customer_reviews.author: John Ennis

customer_reviews.title: light but strong
customer_reviews.text: Too short for our 5th wheel camper, had to make blocks to get enough height. The bases of these are a little over 6 x 6 inches, so I took a 2 X 10 and some scrap 3/4 inch plywood I had laying around and made enough stackable/adjustable blocks to make up the difference. I put 2 of these under the frame rails at the back, and they help reduce some of the flex you feel when someone moves about, but do not totally eliminate movement. I'll try putting another set under the frame rails about half way back next time we camp
customer_reviews.author: Country Boy

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I have a travel trailer with stabilizing jacks and, even with those down, it would still rock and sway a little when walking around. I bought the four pack of these, put them under my trailer and it's amazing. It's solid as can be and there's no swaying or rocking now. That's even with one of the stabilizing jacks not down (the motor switch went out). I certainly didn't expect these to work as well as they have. I put them on concrete pavers for better stability and it seems to be working great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to mesure under you camper
customer_reviews.text: Ok they worked as prescribed so I can't complain. My only problem was how small they were. I have a standard 2014 travel camping trailer same standard frame hight as many on the marke. The bases need to be about 4 inches taller. Now I know they sell taller ones but I needed 4 and prime shipping could get them to the house in 2 days so I took a shot. I was able to block them up and make them work, once I did that it was all good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard  D

customer_reviews.title: Shaking Trailer Fixed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help with my Shaking Travel Trailer Syndrome when parked of course. It isn't bad when it is just me but add the Grandkids and people going in and out of the trailer, it SHAKES! I use these to take this shaking out of the mix and it works very well. They are easy to set up and use. Depending on how the trailer sits on the site I have had to use a block under the jack to reach the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Miser

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed. Now I can load my trailer without it tipping!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a simple jack to keep my trailer from nosing up when loading. These small jacks are perfect. They fit the small Camco pads exactly. I like how the jack stem comes apart for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Stop that shaking and get stable
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. A little smaller than I expected but they do the job and are very well built - or casted I should say. Could be a little more stable so as suggested in another review I added additional nuts on the bottom thread section to improve stability. Be sure to get the right thread specs as I ordered the wrong ones initially. M20-2.5 Metric Finished Hex Nuts, 18-8 Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.author: thomasf

customer_reviews.title: Pretty small
customer_reviews.text: I know the dimensions are listed but when I opened the box the first impression I had was how small they are. They have to sit on top of something that's at least 8 inches tall to reach the bottom of my travel trailer. That means storing more stuff to accommodate the jacks when we travel. Once they are in place they do help stabilize the camper but I'll be looking for something more robust to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small RV.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. Originally I bought the big 24" RV scissor jacks. They were more than what I needed for a small RV (17' Fiberglass Casita). These are quick to set up, Just as quick as the scissor jacks and the set of four probably weighs less than just one scissor jack. I bought them with the camco stabilizer jack pads and they work perfect together.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and light weight make them perfect for the trailer. Sure they are a little wobbly when you don't have any weight on them, but a regular jack stand has some play in it as well. Once you level the trailer out and distribute the weight these do a great job. Especially for the price. Don't expect them to carry the same weight as a car jack stand, but these are very strong. I too almost all the weight off my wheels with these on a 16' camping trailer. At times during leveling I am sure I was putting way more weight than normal on one stand or another and they are holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jamil S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to my problem
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed to stabilize my camper. I have a Coyote hybrid with stabilizers only in the back, so when you walk to the front of the camper, it shakes a bit - until now. These light weight, easy to use stabilizers are perfect for my needs. I can even level the front of the camper with them (I only use them to lift it a little bit to perfect level). If you need something easy to use, store and light weight, then this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Glen R. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Finally, RV is Stable
customer_reviews.text: My Class C didn't have stabilizers when I bought it. Upon a recommendation from an RV shop, they told me to buy four of these instead of spending a lot of money for stabilizers/levelers. They were easy to set up and made my RV much steadier and without the rocking when I'm walking around (and when the wind is blowing).
customer_reviews.author: Joanie

customer_reviews.title: Did not work :(
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted these to work....we tried them on 2 different trips. The first one was on gravel, so we thought we would give them another chance. The second trip was on pavement, and we noticed no difference at all. We would return these if we could, but our return window has passed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a Rock for a camper.
customer_reviews.text: Have camper with typical rear jacks. It shook like crazy and I needed a solution that didn't cost $300. Bought these, set each on a cement block, one under the steps, one on opposite side under slideout. PERFECT. I am 225lbs and side to side shake went from high to near zero! Perfect for this use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: ... my desk to a standing desk and they worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I used these to convert my desk to a standing desk and they worked like a charm. IF you plan on doing it I suggest the following: Mount 4 pieces of 1x1 that are about 3/4's of an inch thick on the bottom of all four corners of your desk.. so they are kinda like feet. . Then buy 1 inch (or 1 1/2 inch, I can't remember which) PVC pipe joints that fit over the jack heads and the 1x1s. It makes the desk a lot more stable. I lean against mine all the time and it just wiggles a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Etrit

customer_reviews.title: Improved stability
customer_reviews.text: They are not a quick setup but since we sometimes stay at one site for weeks they are worth the effort to stabilize the RV. I have 2 sets so my RV gets plenty of support. These are easier to setup prior to puttin out the slideouts. Removing easier after slides are put in. They do help stabilize but nothings perfect but I recommend using especially if staying put for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Brown

customer_reviews.title: Strong, lightweight, and aluminum.  Great for stabilizing a travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to stabilize my camper a little better. They're strong, lightweight, and easy to use. No, not as easy to use as a steel scissor jack, but they're aluminum and won't rust like steel scissor jacks. They stack on each other, and fit easily in my plastic tote with all my other camping supplies. I'd buy these again. Was a great price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Man

customer_reviews.title: Hard to believe these are rated at 6, 000lbs ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe these are rated at 6,000lbs. each. They are much smaller than expected. The box say's not to be used to support a vehicle or RV....only to stabilize. Doesn't make much sence. I plan to lift my RV off the suspension and take some pressure off the tires for winter. Hope the heck these little things work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.text: These are the bees knees. Using these for our 1973 Apache Roamer that has some old stability jacks that suck the life out of me when trying to set up camp. Super easy to install, not need to weld or anything tough. Just put under the pop up under the braces and twist. No more bouncing and now the dog can itch himself and not wake us all up anymore. Getchu a set and save some time and cash.
customer_reviews.author: Chad E. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever for shipments
customer_reviews.text: Well it was packaged vary well And so far so good. They feel cheaply Made but ehh 10 dollers a stand What more could you want? Well im Happy to say my Rv dose not rock n roll So much. But id say another set of 4 Will do the trick. And remember these are Only to help level the rv. I.e. i used 2 jacks side By side on both sides to double its capacity Load😉
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G

customer_reviews.title: Best value around!
customer_reviews.text: outstanding price for 4 jack stands. Works really well with my 17' vintage aristocrat lo liner. It used to shake back and forth with any little movement and now it's solid and doesn't sway at all. We use our trailer as a mobile retail store and it's key that it doesn't move- both for the customer and for the sake of our displayed merchandise. These are great! You would think for the cheap $ you'd get cheap product that didn't work...not the case. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Halloran

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than expected
customer_reviews.text: I really expected a much lighter duty part. These are pretty well built and like how the jacking nut sits in a hexagon recess. We bought them as a cheap and easy way to reduce shake and bounce in our long RV. They did not eliminate it but when set up in addition to the trailer stabilizers the movement is very reduced.
customer_reviews.author: 2-Step

customer_reviews.title: These work well
customer_reviews.text: These work well. Light. They nest and go back in the box when not in use. We use them on the travel trailer, in addition to the corner stabilizer jacks, whenever we're sitting somewhere for a while. A couple on each side, in front of and behind the wheels, to prevent annoying jiggle when someone walks through the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Lady

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Fine.
customer_reviews.text: I support my food trailer with this. I use a bottle jack to raise it to level, and set this up next to it. The screw gives you the exact height you need for leveling. Unlike my jack stand. Make sure that your base is level. Especially when the height is maxed out. L I do a lot of moving around when cooking, and it is very stable. It’s nice to have a perfectly level griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Dave McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Stand for Multiple Purposes
customer_reviews.text: Very good for supporting RV slides, steps, etc or other items around the house or garage. I used four of them to lift some 50 lb storage cabinets into place for installation on a wall. The screw thread provides for infinite adjustment unlike jack stands that must click into place. Rough adjustment can be obtained very quickly by picking up on post and spinning the nut. Note that the stand is not beefy and are aluminum so they are not made for heavy weight. Also the threaded rod is steel and can rust.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Berlin

customer_reviews.title: Camper is solid as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: These have totally met my expectations. My pop-up camper is a 1971 Starcraft. Apparently in the early 70s, a camper that doesn't shift around while walking in it wasn't a top priority. As a result, my camper is supported by two stands in the back, and the trailer jack. Three points, was not enough. Today the box is supported at each corner. I can step into the camper without the slightest shifting. The nut design is nice for storage. Each stand nests inside each other, while the bolts are removed.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Solid product that works great for trailer steps!
customer_reviews.text: We put these under our steps on the trailer when we take the kids camping. They keep the trailer from wobbling around every time someone is walking around inside. I don’t know how we survived without them! They are easy to use and really make a big difference! We did try plastic ones before and that was a disaster. Spend a little more for a better product like this one. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: rock solid
customer_reviews.text: These don't take any longer to setup than the crank down ones that came with trailer. They don't have any rocking while walking like the original crackdowns. And a lot quicker to remove, if you raise the hitch to slide out the front ones, then lower the hitch to remove rears. Beats the dickens over cranking up the old ones. This is a case where simple is best.
customer_reviews.author: Georga F. Silver

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: The thing is totally unusable. The nut isn't fastened to the stand and the pad doesn't rotate when under pressure so it walks right out from under the RV frame. Unless you jack the RV and set it directly down in this junk, it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have them buy them. Our tow behind is 30 feet long even with stabilizers down it has a bounce and with little kids moving around all night these little gems are a must. One under each axle on each side makes a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: David Peters

customer_reviews.title: I use these to stabilize my camper after leveling.
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I also bought the Camco Stabilizing Jack Pads to go under them so they don't sink into the dirt at all.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: For not a lot of money you get a functional RV stand, what do you want? The biggest problem is the cup that hits the bottom of the trailer doesn't spin independently. Therefore just as you are getting it tight the entire jack will rotate and wobble which could cause the cup to fall off the trailer frame. Do not buy this product thinking you are getting a great price on a good RV jack. You are getting a threaded rod with a handle and a base. I would be disappointed if I had spent a lot of money but for the price; whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Berit

customer_reviews.title: They are ok.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced some mounted jacks with these. the mounted jacks would not let me get the camper in or out of the driveway. They work but are harder to deal with then the mounted. Will use until i find something better.
customer_reviews.author: Ratsan

customer_reviews.title: Great for campers
customer_reviews.text: One of the corner Jack's broke off my camper due to poor quality so I purchased these. They work perfectly and are light weight and easy to place. I am a woman and I do not like to lift heavy things. These are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Do what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use under my trailer when loading or unloading my ATV when not connected to a vehicle. When we are camping I will use them to level the unladen trailer, which we use as "patio" for our table and barbecue. They are not heavy duty, but completely adequate for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: D. D. LeDu

customer_reviews.title: Protection
customer_reviews.text: If you're a camper and want to protect your camper for years to come, you're always interested in maintaining the level of your camper, it always works to have numerous supports available. If you've done a lot of shopping you've discovered that for this price you usually get 2 in lieu of 4. Good by and good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kingo

customer_reviews.title: Using for our bus conversion project.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 4 pack for less than what a 2 pack sells for at the store. We are using them to work on our bus. We are converting a bus into an RV and these will come in handy for keeping everything lifted and secure. A crazier simple life our bus adventure will even be showing these stands as the project progresses. The hold the amount of weight we need and them some, I am very happy with the quality and the fact that I saved a bunch of money!
customer_reviews.author: Tamika Shy

customer_reviews.title: 4 pack of stabilizers lifts they work well
customer_reviews.text: I use this for pack of stabilizers to help steady my travel trailer in the parking spot we have it. I highly recommend these they're easy to set up an easy to use period depending on the height of the application you may need a few large blocks of wood the base is 8x8. Good product okay price fast shipping so far quality product. I recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Works great and super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made. They work great for stabilizing our travel trailer that only has rear stabilizers and are very quick to set up. I use some of my leveling blocks underneath to avoid using them with the screw at longer extensions. Some people have bent them this way but I don't think you would experience this under a travel trailer which does not sway nack and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Cody G.

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk, fell apart on me under easy wear n test in a couple months
customer_reviews.text: All 4 fell apart in a couple months on my winnibago and it's not even a 30+ foot model.. it's much lighter.. these are just junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Micale "Hawk" Professional Pool Player & Instructor for Daytonajay Billiards LLC, Retired ASE Master Auto Technician

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for holding up my tiny house on wheels
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for holding up my tiny house on wheels. I needed to buy a total of 8 to keep the trailer from bowing but the strength and stability are perfect. Not for lifting only for holding. You need to bring your own jack to lift the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Quiet Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Just What You Need
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light weight but still provides good stability. Love how adjustable they are. Bought damaged ones but they were in perfect condition. Easy to use and store. They are stackable. Great jacks.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn McClymont

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! This little jack will stabilize shaky floors in your hose as well ( at least those built with a crawl-space). I placed a set in various spots in my crawl-space and quieted all the rattles-as-we-walk spots! I wouldn't use them to "lift" a whole lot but they sure can keep the rooms from shaking!
customer_reviews.author: ZmanTN

customer_reviews.title: RV Must have
customer_reviews.text: Our Camper was rocking when parked. I bought these and placed them under the front and the RV is very stable. I do recommend they be installed on a block of wood or leveling block to work best.
customer_reviews.author: J Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had given my mechanic hubby a set of stands a couple of years ago, and he loaned them out and never got them back. These are a good replacement. They're pretty basic, but they do the trick and are fairly sturdy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Stilwell

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: We use these on the back of our camper because we have a washer/dryer and it shook the camper. These stabilized it. Good quality. They were packaged nicely and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Frydog

customer_reviews.title: They're fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: They're fine for the price, and might be all you need for a small pop-up camper. However, they only do an "ok" job with my old 27' motorhome. It still bounces around as people move or even wiggle despite these. Maybe with more wood underneath them so that they are barely unscrewed it would work better. They aren't very tall, but they do stack up pretty small. I haven't had any rust problems but I don't leave them out other than deploying for camping.
customer_reviews.author: harbinjer

customer_reviews.title: Buy Here way cheaper
customer_reviews.text: RV or travel trailer stabilization Jack's are easily double this price in any retail store and in turn the RV Center nearest me they ran $75 for A4 pack. These are the same brand same Jax offered in that store at a fraction of the price. I've used them 2 weeks camping at a state park in semi unlevel ground with my homemade RV teardrop travel trailer and they worked excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mittenman

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are great for a variety of trailer applications, making walking around in/on the trailer stable and safe from tipping. And the price is great, less than $10 each
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to store and move around
customer_reviews.text: small, easy to store and move around, good for temporary blocking under our 37 foot camper but we'll have to upgrade to something more heavy duty because our camper still sways and rocks with 6 of these under it, plus the 4 original scissor jacks that are on the camper
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: very stable
customer_reviews.text: I use four of these to stabilize my trailer when camping in it. work great! I even used two of them once to hold the tongue up when I had to change out my front jack. worked perfectly. no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Moorby

customer_reviews.title: DONT GET THE SMALLEST SIZE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 17-23" jacks which are way to short for my truck camper, its my fault, should have bought the bigger size. Had to use 4 pieces of 12x10 stacked with a 6x4 on top across the two jacks front then the same on the back. I'll see if I can upload a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Keezer

customer_reviews.title: Better late than never!
customer_reviews.text: Should have invested in these for our pop up tent trailer ten years ago! Bought a set of four and that was the perfect number to effectively stabilize our 20 foot camper. Much cheaper and simpler to use than other options, too. Highly, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sealed Fate

customer_reviews.title: Used for wildlife cameras
customer_reviews.text: Aluminum was rust proof ideal for outside camera mounts around rural house. Used U bolts to clamp wood extensions to mount cameras off of. Have no idea how well they work for vehicle support.
customer_reviews.author: Verryl F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, and fast to use.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to use. I did add another extra nut and washer for more stability. Per video from YouTube video recommendation to add the extra for more sturdiness. Been under my horse trailer ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use this to raise my boat every year to paint the bottom. I leave the jacks outside year-round and never had an issue. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Helps stabilize the Camper
customer_reviews.text: We added this to our camper jacks to help stabilize the camper more with out a large expense. They did the trick. Happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: HIA

customer_reviews.title: Did the job they were intended to do.
customer_reviews.text: Used along with conventional jackstands to level my car restoration project. Worked great for fine tuning but do not substitute for suitable jackstands.
customer_reviews.author: Commodore

customer_reviews.title: Jacked up
customer_reviews.text: These were the perfect addition to our camping supplies. My husband wanted additional jacks for our camper and we looked at various spots in town and online to find what we wanted at an affordable price. We got both with this particular product. They wre exactly as described and just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: 5rupples

customer_reviews.title: Good jacks
customer_reviews.text: Can only speak from my experience, use these on my car & moms two or three times each to change out tires they work with no issues. Their are also light weight, but dependable so fare from 2017 to today 5/16/2019.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious
customer_reviews.text: These have a clever recess at the top that is shaped like the nut and holds the nut in place without welding. Disassembly is very quick; just lift threaded bolt out of the stand. High quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Coogan

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with Stability
customer_reviews.text: I park my travel trailer on a hill. The jacks that came with the RV would bottom out. So, I removed them and now use these, which provide just as much stability.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional jacks for the money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little stands, I use these under our truck camper when it's off the truck -- drop all four of the camper's jacks, lay down large timbers on four of these Camco jacks and distribute the weight, which is easy to do as these adjust nicely. You won't be able to lift the whole camper with the crank, of course, but you can set these underneath and lift up enough to take a lot of weight. The result is a rock-solid camper that doesn't wiggle at all while I fiddle around inside.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppin' Dad

customer_reviews.title: Works Well - Not a Replacement for Scissor Jacks
customer_reviews.text: Good lightweight jacks. Fine for simple use, but I would not try to replace heavy duty scissor jack as those are easier to crank under load than these aluminium, short handle, jacks. I use this jack to support my RV steps.
customer_reviews.author: JustTheFactsMaam

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Used this on our small camper. Worked great. Because the bottom is open you will need to sit them on a board if the camper sites is on dirt or grass.
customer_reviews.author: L A Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for what they are; do NOT try to lift or hold a D8 with these. They are definitely not suitable for holding up a car, for example, even a Reliant Robin, and they make that clear. You'll need something more substantial for that.
customer_reviews.author: Moburner

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and light priced
customer_reviews.text: They are lightweight and definitely aluminum. I honestly though they would crumble under my 1981 26' wilderness. One of the top connectors did bend when not pereftly centered. They are lightweight, but they do work.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel Snow

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have for some extra balance
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to have since one side of parking RV it gives me a little extra comfort in leveling out even with extra jacks on RV
customer_reviews.author: Commdrdave

customer_reviews.title: Light, sturdy and they nest
customer_reviews.text: I have been using car jack stands - they are heavy, large and awkward. These are perfect and take up about 1/5 the space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacks
customer_reviews.text: These are just to be used as stabilizers. They are not heavy enough to lift any thing. They are compact and light but serve their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great value for stabilizing a small trailer.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for stabilizing a small tear drop trailer. The 4-pack was actually cheaper than the two-pack. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: bskousen

customer_reviews.title: No Moe Rocking
customer_reviews.text: Jacks came as advertised. Leveled the camper and then set the stabilizer jacks under the frame. After adding these stabilizer jacks our camper is rock solid. Also got another set for the two slid outs. Very happy with the product. Our 32 foot travel trailer is setup at the lake and stays there year round.
customer_reviews.author: Stickarcher

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I have ever purchased! They have worked great, simple to get setup, and no more ‘sea legs’ when your walking about inside the RV. I also like the fact that I can pack them away quickly and store them easily using just a minimum of storage space.
customer_reviews.author: bdautotech

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight, strong, and compact stabilizers
customer_reviews.text: The aluminum bases 'telescope' together and the steel bolts can get pulled out for easy compact storage. They are lightweight so that helps with overall vehicle weight. My RV trailer has two built-in stabilizers in the back and when adding these two additional stabilizers under the chassis (frame) at left and right in the front, it makes a HUGE difference for stabilizing the trailer. Use jack pad(s) or wood block(s) as needed for a bit more height. I would not recommend 'lifting' the RV and taking all the weight off the tires, however load up these stabilizers with some of the load and eliminate much of the movement of the RV.
customer_reviews.author: N. White

customer_reviews.title: Helps level trailer every time
customer_reviews.text: Used to level and stabilize our food trailer. These definitely do the trick. And they don’t take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Rogers Jr

customer_reviews.title: lightweight compact jacks
customer_reviews.text: Haven't use it yet. Looks pretty small and lightweight. My only concern is it may not be tall enough for my RV trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great price and supported my camper with no issues. No heavy duty but perfect for a set and forget application.
customer_reviews.author: JBJ

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I use four of these stands on a 7x16 cargo trailer to stabilize it. They are light weight and work great.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteyPLS

customer_reviews.title: Recommended..
customer_reviews.text: These work fine for what they are intended for, stabilizing a camper, not lifting it or holding up extreme weights. I use them on my 32' camper with 3 slides and they help control the rocking noticeably.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Totally Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied with these. We use them on our pop up camper. The extra stability works great. They are just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I got these to stabilize a 3000 lb. camping trailer. It had stabilizers on the back but swayed in the front. These work great and firm up the trailer well. They are also very lightweight and easy to stow away. Setup is easy, too. A very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Deuce Domino

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price. I used this set of 4 jack stands to stabilize a cargo trailer that is fully loaded. I was able to get the weight off of the tires. Appears to be high quality. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: 2017 premier 27' camper, work great
customer_reviews.text: help hold her up, cheap jacks they put on are failing after 1 year use so these are good, use blocks with them
customer_reviews.author: Hoscap

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the stability jacks. Easy to set up under my camper. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mom, Mammy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, seem really well made
customer_reviews.text: Just out of the box they are good quality and seem like they will be easy to use. Look forward to putting them through a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel T

customer_reviews.title: They look a little light
customer_reviews.text: Looks can be deceiving though. I bought them for stabilizing jacks for my camper. They work great and they are light, easy to handle. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: scottidog

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Been set up for a few hours and i am more than pleased. Installation was easy, camper much more sturdy.....lets just see if they stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: john a juras

customer_reviews.title: Great stability
customer_reviews.text: Best thing we ever bought for our camper. Wish we would have found these years ago. Best ever.
customer_reviews.author: SmithFamily

customer_reviews.title: Almost rock solid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a inexpensive way to stabalize our camper and to keep it from rocking so much while inside. I put one between the axles and have them press snug against the frame. These along with the 2 stair supports I use under the first and second steps to help support the stairs while going in an out of the camper seems to stop 95% of the rocking. Makes moving around inside the camper much more pleasent if someone is trying to sleep. I only use two fo them but I might just use all 4 for a week long camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: a1avet

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good product. I was please with the shipping from the vendor, not fast but on time. The stands are a bit smaller then expected, suppose I could have looked at the overall dimensions more carefully. I needed to shore them a bit being that the trailer is on un-level ground to begin with however they work just fine on our 2007 Aljo. Small, lightweight design, break down fast and easy, and a snap to store. I gave the bolts a light coat of oil to help slow any rust being they are not galvanized.
customer_reviews.author: K9MDD

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Great product for taking the shake from the travel trailer. I am very pleased with the results. These will take most of the tire roll out that allows the bounce and movement in travel trailer tires and frames. These are small, light weight and adjustable. Nothing will take all the movement out of the travel trailer, but these drastically reduce how the kids shake our trailer. I highly recommend these if you want to reduce the bounce and shake from your travel trailer too.
customer_reviews.author: Menz

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, used these on the 4 corners of my rv, and couldn't be happier! Amazing difference, cant believe I went this long without them. Rv does not move at all, I cant even feel my wife roll around in bed when I'm in the living area.
customer_reviews.author: Barry VT

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and simple
customer_reviews.text: I knocked off my stablizers by accident and have just been living without them for the past year. I saw these and their reasonable price so took a chance. Makes a huge difference without any fuss. I placed them on 2 lego blox so that I didn't have to extend them much. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Martinez

product_meta.title: Camco Olympian Aluminum Stack Jacks, Stabilize, Position And Level Your RV, Trailer Or Camper, Can Support Up to 6,000 lbs, Extends 17" - (4 Pack) (44560)
product_meta.description: Size:4 PackCamco Olympian RV Aluminum Stack Jack Stands are designed to get secure and level RV positioning and stability. They are made from durable cast aluminum and each can support up to 6000 lb. These Jack Stands extend from 11" - 17" and are easy to use. Comes with a set of (4) stack jacks.
feature_bullets: Stabilizes and Levels your RV: Designed to get secure and level RV positioning and stability
Superior Strength: Each jack supports up to 6000 pound
Durable Construction: Made of cast aluminum
Adjustable: Extends from 11 inch to 17 inch
Includes: Comes with a set of (4) stack jacks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,085 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
